info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 5:31PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Gila and Maricopa Counties through 615 PM MST... At 531 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near McDowell Mountain Park to near Round Valley. Movement was south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Scottsdale, Fountain Hills, Round Valley, Sugarloaf Mountain, Ballantine Trailhead, Sunflower, Punkin Center, McDowell Mountain Park, Goldfield Ranch, Four Peaks, Camp Creek, Rio Verde, Tonto Basin and Fort McDowell. This includes the following highways... AZ Route 87 between mile markers 196 and 220. AZ Route 188 between mile markers 261 and 262. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.
